comment: Even though he had a strict no phone policy and his lectures are boring, people would've enjoyed him if he was teaching any other subject.

I took it online, so I can't speak for in-person. Very easy class online. Lecture videos are clear and thorough, and the quizzes on said lectures represent the topics that were gone over. Never thought about philosophy much, but this class has been very interesting and not stressful at all. Definently recommend online if possible. Free A+

his assignments were just two quizzes due before class over readings on what he would be lecturing about, and then  exams after each module. he gives you the questions in advance so you dont go into quizzes and tests blind. hes a weirdo, felt uncomfortable a lot in his class and he never seemed to know what he was talking about. pretty easy though

Philosophy is not a subject I find interesting at all. He helped make it more tolerable though. I think I'd like him better if he was teaching a subject I cared about. He's quite animated when speaking. Some lectures are definitely better than others.

Show. Up. To. Class!!! While some of the lectures can get lengthy and perhaps arduous at times, the overall course is interesting. He's a younger guy so some of the ways through which he conveys the subjects can be more modern (read: memes). Take as many notes as you possibly can- summary quizzes are pulled directly from class content. No final.

It was his first summer semester this year and it was BAD. I don't know about the full term he teaches but in summer there were nearly 3hr "lectures" in which he could barely cover any subject matter and it felt unprepared every time. He would also continue saying nothing even after the scheduled session was over. Graded quizzes bad, very nitpicky.

No textbook, work due days R-U. Professor Downey is a Tough Grader, but if you apply yourself and show work, he will help you succeed in the class. His Lectures are the KEY for the whole course. No final. He is truly an amazing speaker. His lectures are super interesting. You have to want it, earned it!  You CAN'T QUIZLET your way out of this one.

I took this class in Fall 2023 and I took it online. He had 2 due dates every week, Thursdays and Sundays. He doesn't papers/exams/discussion post, all his assignments are quizzes. If you expect to not watch his videos and just do his quizzes you will fail. His lecture videos are pretty interesting though.

He gets boring really quick, and the reading isn't thought-provoking. This could be a history class. There was a 3 question quiz, and I got one so I failed the quiz. Emailed him with my reasoning, and he did the "Let me answer ur question with anthr question", refused to give me even a half point back. The sex jokes got uncomfortable.

long lectures every week, harsh grader. multiple quizzes every week, but they are usually short and open note. things due on multiple days throughout the week so you can't do everything on sunday. is expecting very specific answers to his questions

He is a veryyyy hard grader with the weekly quizzes. He did post great lectures but sometimes went too into the content to where it got a little confusing at times. I do recommend him as the course wasn't stressful or overbearing, just know he is a very tough grader.

He assigns about 2 assignments a week, but honestly they don't take longer than an hour each. I pretty much did them an hour or 2 before class and did pretty fine. Attendance is mandatory but its in xchaenge for no exams or essays. He does get into politics at the end, but it covers political philosophies like Marxism, Capitalism, Neoliberalism.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Amazing lectures --Clear grading criteria

comment: There is a lot of reading, and most of the reading has a quiz attached to it. Quizzes make up pretty much your whole grade, and if you miss more than 2 classes he starts taking points off your final grade. Most of the quizzes and content are based on his personal opinions, but he isn't a bad professor. He does curse a lot in class though
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Beware of pop quizzes--Lecture heavy

comment: Points taken off grade for attendance, quizzes are largely based on the professors opinions on topics. Be ready to learn a lot about the Profs philosophy, and less about philosophy or thinking critically yourself.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Lots of homework

comment: Extremely easy class. Based professor. Graded on quizzes and exams, material is derived directly from lectures and readings. No lockdown browser. Material he teaches is actually interesting. Certain people hate his class because he discusses the dark side of capitalism and how it ties into philosophy, but he makes good points.

The final grade consists of 70 percent quiz and 30 percent test scores. It is interesting to read philosophy books, but the exam questions are elusive, especially the first part. At the end of the semester, he gave each of us three extra points to make up for difficult questions.

Recent ratings are poor due to his political beliefs. Its an easy class, the readings can be difficult, especially the early topics and the lectures are long winded. However this is an easy professor to take to get your gen ed class out of the way. No final or tests just reading quizzes. Attendance is mandatory, no electronics.

99% of the class is him just preaching is political beliefs, almost nothing to actually do with philosophy.
My friends are learning about real philosophers in their PHIL2200 classes and I'm being taught about Elon Musk's family being unjustly rich from an emrald mine in africa??? he does not teach philosophy, he teaches his own political beliefs

only take if you're actually interested and v open minded about learning philosophy (which i was). these bad reviews are just people refusing to engage with the content because it makes them uncomfortable. not much wrong with him but the teaching style is a little boring (long powerpoint lectures) and mandatory attendance. gave literally 0 tests :)

do not take him. He is very creepy and talks about and I quote "why we all want to f our moms" he really focuses on that and all we do is read. His lectures make no sense because he uses improper grammar. Attendance is mandatory.
This class requires a lot of thinking and being thorough. Getting an A is a little hard if you're not into the subject. Quizzes every week but they're very short and quick.

I was not excited to take this class but Mr Downey made it enjoyable. It is a bit confusing at first but if you listen to the lectures you’re set. Maximum of 2 quizzes a week but they’re 1-4 questions. He definitely wants his students to do well so if you have any questions shoot him an email.

The class was pretty simple and he only cared about attendence. Every week had two readings that would take 30-60 minutes each. The grades came from open note quizzes from the readings and the final follows the same formula. I did not pay attention in the class at all but managed to get an A so you can too.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Lots of homework

comment: Professor Downey is a great professor. He grades fairly quickly, is accessible outside of class, holds small reviews and gives very thorough lectures. His quizzes are pretty easy but answers sometimes have to be very specific. There is no homework, only quizzes.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--Lecture heavy

comment: As of fall semester 2021 the only grades are attendance and easy open note reading quizzes. Some of the early material of Daoism/Buddhism can be kind of boring but the later material is actually quite interesting. Also he's a communist which is cool.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Not sure where these bad reviews are coming from.... glad I chose philosophy with him over a third English course. Its just busy work with very few short papers. Literally just read the transcripts and skim the material he posts and youll get an A. His lectures are interesting too if you actually look at the content.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Lots of homework--Accessible outside class

comment: If you do not absolutely have to take this class, then don't. Not a very helpful professor. Assigns too many readings with little time. The write-ups take forever. Also, he is never clear on his quizzes and does nothing to prepare you for any content. Worst professor I have ever had. Save yourself the time and hassle.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lecture heavy--Tough grader

comment: Professor Downey is one of the best professors I've had in college. He will work with you through thick and thin and will insure you get the best grade for your work. I would never take this class again but if I say Dr. Downey teaching a different class that I was looking to take, I would take it in a heartbeat.

Workload was out of this world, I have never done so much reading in so little time. Typically there are two readings to do a week with a minimum 1 page write up on both. For like 4 weeks we had video lists that could have up to 2 hours of videos PLUS articles to do write ups on. As a person, great guy; as a professor, professional torturer.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Lots of homework--Get ready to read

comment: Great professor, loves his job, and easy to learn from. LOTS of reading and summarizing. 26 one page summaries from readings that can range from 15-60 pages & 3 tests. The amount of work is very overwhelming w/ 2 summaries due each week but if you do it all you can guarantee yourself an A. Also does some weeks of video lists that take FOREVER
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--So many papers

comment: THIS PROFESSOR IS TERRIBLE. DO NOT RECOMMEND TAKING HIM. HE GIVES UNBELIEVABLE AMOUNT OF READING AND LECTURES. HE SPEAKS SLOWLY AND DOES NOT OFFER ANY HELP.

If philosophy bores you, don't take this class, it's incredibly lecture-heavy. You're graded on 25 readings, 4 exams you have a week to do, and three discussions or quizzes. As for his lectures, they're generally pretty good, although some had me about to fall asleep. He's real forgiving about readings too so just skim and go back later if you must
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--Lecture heavy

comment: Prof. Downey is a good Professor. His tests are quite time consuming but they're online and if you read you should be ok. DO NOT MISS CLASS. His attendance policy is TOUGH, but he's a very kind person and cares about his students. Also, if you would like some philosophical political insight, I suggest taking him.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Test heavy--Lecture heavy

comment: Hes actually a very nice professor but please dont take this class. Workload is heavy and overwhelming and attendance counts for a huge part of your grade. Homework due every time you meet. Written exams. He speaks over time every class. Only take him if youre willing to put in LOTS of time and effort or if you need it for your major.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lots of homework

comment: His lectures are very long and sometimes go over time. He has a very monotone voice that can sometimes make you want to sleep but sometimes he says something that grabs your attention. There is a lot of at home reading and writing that sometimes feels a bit excessive.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Skip class? You won't pass.--Lecture heavy

comment: I expected Philosophy to be a class I would just take for the credit, but Professor Downey make the subject quite enjoyable. His lectures are quite good and he also took time to have discussions with the class each time the class met. The "tests" are take home assignments that he will give you feedback on before you turn in a final copy.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--Amazing lectures

comment: He's a cool dude in general, but as a professor try to avoid. Lectures are basically him talking at you, and attempts to discuss are ignored. He emailed us at the end of the semester and told us that he taught the class as a 4000 level class, so the content was too hard and most of the class was constantly confused. Easy grader, but hard content.

Justin was a wonderful guy. He is very agreeable and has insightful and interesting lectures. His lessons can be a bit outlandish, but Philosophy is about having an open mind, and it can be very enlightening if you let it be. His exams aren't too difficult if you know what to do. I recommend him if you need this class. It was a great experience.
It appears as though my last comment was removed.. Long story short.. Avoid him at all costs..
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.--LOTS OF HOMEWORK

comment: At first, I was able (barely) to look past the excruciating lectures and ridiculously long and frequent readings because the quizzes were simple and straight forward. The tests on the other hand are opinionated. He grades harsher than anyone I've had before. I did all the readings and followed all criteria and BOMBED it. AN OPINIONATED TEST!!!!
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Get ready to read--BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES

comment: Prof. Downey is cool, he assigns some really interesting material. Lectures are a little atypical, so good note taking is crucial. He's really open about feedback for test questions, ask clarifying questions and he will help you get on track. Enjoyed the class, would take again. Attendance not mandatory but will help significantly in the long run.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: This is a philosophy course, you must read the pieces by ancient philosophers which you may find incredibly boring, but that is the class. Professor Downey lectures like any other professor but I would refute the claim that his voice is monotone as I did not find it to be. Attendance is not mandatory but there are pop quizzes. Performance is on you
rating_tags: Get ready to read--BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: I took his class nearly a year ago, and it really made me think. Mr. Downey is an excellent lecturer, and really makes his classes interesting. I signed up for his class by chance, but I didn't regret it at all. As long as you're able to think outside the box, this class is an easy A. For those who have a more closed mind, I would not suggest it.

I absolutely loved this class! Actually do the reading, not only because what he has you read is insightful and interesting, but also because it follows his lectures and helps you better understand the concepts. His tests focus on your understanding of the concepts and ideas he covers in class, rather than memorization.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES--Hilarious

comment: Professor Downey is funny, reasonable, and nice. If you find philosophy interesting, you should definitely take him. His lectures are long and monotone but if you actually listen, what he says is very eye opening.

He is very different. He rambles on about random things. Lectures are long and boring. However, the tests are online so you can look up answers. He doesn't care about attendance. He gives lots of pop quizzes on readings so if you don't read you will fail.

His lectures are long and usually boring,  but he's a cute and funny guy. The exams are based off the readings and his opinions in class. Definitely do the readings because your grade depends on being able to pass the constant pop quizzes. As long as you show up and sometimes pay attention, you'll do fine.

Readings are mandatory; however, quizzes are often difficult and, even when one reads the material, can still be impossible to answer correctly. Lectures are both long and often aimless. Attendance isn't mandatory, but is still necessary if one stands even a shot on the tests. TAKE GOOD NOTES. I would likely not take this professor again.

Professor Downey at times was confusing and not really to the point, his test are mainly on what he would lecture and what he would sometimes ramble on. There is no textbook, he assigns readings that he posts on D2L, get ready to read a lot. It is definetly a discussion kind of class. Above all, he was an understanding professor.

Worst teach I have ever had. His entire class is a lecture, but he speaks so monotone. On top of being uninteresting to listen to, the material he talks about is confusing. His class is so dead that nobody will even ask questions for clarification. His exams are purely based off  of his personal opinions described in his lecture. Don't take him!

If you are in philosophy for content, you will be pleased. I am still contemplating his teachings to this day. Very classical and platonic subject matter. He is young which could be hit or miss. Attendance isn't mandatory, but most of the test material is from the lectures. The class is easy, as long as you put in effort (read the readings). 10/10

Very interesting class. Towards the end the information got a little repetitive. You HAVE to read the readings. There were reading quizzes almost weekly. Young and relatable teacher. He has a different way of teaching that is a hit or miss with students. I personally loved the class. He was very understanding as long as you communicated with him.

I really liked Mr. Downey. He is very interesting and I'm always engaged when he teaches. He really pushes for discussion participation, which is kind of scary. YOU MUST READ THE READINGS! I found the essays to be tough but I did well on the multiple choice tests. Pop quizzes happen so heads up. If you read the readings, the pop quizzes are easy.
